During a rushed deployment, part of the private RSA key leaked with this encrypted message: 6341816872366259887502720973291410669499131481077554471129298672916244119693659338517892135870157490888757704809841069911039680657952275646085603661211344. Can you recover the secret using the partial key exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8500957470977502684127760041323727236745580478840827392800284359161427518759982404147994199207928076103700143698931349909959919164455843496203245617966141, e=6474186284936804780075046721151251213813244852124284844506581060894457496360603235964739042316339089147772864124932959696925634426127006551414666084455253, partial_p=13360498510030657355

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{hif8mvre}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6341816872366259887502720973291410669499131481077554471129298672916244119693659338517892135870157490888757704809841069911039680657952275646085603661211344
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8500957470977502684127760041323727236745580478840827392800284359161427518759982404147994199207928076103700143698931349909959919164455843496203245617966141, e=6474186284936804780075046721151251213813244852124284844506581060894457496360603235964739042316339089147772864124932959696925634426127006551414666084455253, partial_p=13360498510030657355
extra_info: p=83865208382944601956132586817315963714274271751162694287733389327695617408069, q=101364530475623489882358030363628837649897608767265364742014121906197862792089, Ï†(n)=8500957470977502684127760041323727236745580478840827392800284359161427518759797174409135631116089585486519198897567178029441491105426095984969352137765984
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
